entry.title: Batman Is
entry.summary:
Author: NotCassia

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,227Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 16

Summary: "You're just letting us go?!" "It's like you said. You're not my pickings to deal with." "Ha! Look around boy scout! Bats isn't here. We lost him ages ago." Nick was regretting his decision not to punch Tony. Superman raised a single brow. "Did you?" Silence. "Unless you can see him, I sure as hell can't." Tony hissed out through grit teeth. "That's his whole shtick. You're not supposed to see him coming. And if you do, it's because he wanted you to." Silence. Silence except for Nick's heavy breathing. He was beyond foolish for ever entertaining the idea that they'd gotten away. "You ride his dick this often?" "Tony!" Nick hissed. He wasn't planning on getting killed by Tony's fat mouth. "You actually think you got away?" Superman questioned sincerely. He sounded baffled. And Nick's terror was only growing. "Even if he's still after us, he'll get tired of chasing us eventually." "Not before you do."

entry.title: Weak flowers bloom thanks to the poisoned man.
entry.summary:
Author: Killermer21

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,824Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Summary: In a Gotham without Batman, Bruce Wayne disappeared after his parents’ death and returned transformed by the unknown, caught between man and curse: the Poisonman. Through abandoned alleys and forgotten streets, some orphans cross his path, unaware if they have found a savior or a monster. As the city deteriorates and the Justice League watches, the question arises: is he an enemy, an ally… or a problem impossible to control? Gotham will never be the same, and the fate of the children who in this universe never became Robins is about to change. ("In other words, I read IMMORTAL LEGEND BATMAN chapter #4 and loved the Bruce Wayne Poison Ivy version/The poisoned man and decided to write this thing instead of sleeping")

entry.title: The Dark Knight Before Christmas - A Superbat Year One AU
entry.summary:
Author: EllEmmeCe

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,400Chapters: 14/25Kudos: 15

Summary: Gotham is having a very strange Christmas. Bruce Wayne’s latest vigilante experiment, a horned shadowy figure the press has named “Krampus,” was supposed to terrify criminals. Instead, it has gone viral as Gotham’s new holiday mascot. Clark Kent, investigative reporter and part-time baker, is on the case. He is following Krampus’s trail of cookie crumbs (literally) while secretly moonlighting as “Super Santa” to fix Gotham’s holiday chaos. Between gingerbread turtle clues, a viral photo of Krampus tangled in Christmas lights, and Alfred’s endless commentary, Bruce is one bad cape snag away from losing his mind. Meanwhile, Clark is just trying to figure out if Gotham’s scariest new legend is a monster, a myth, or a very grumpy man who needs a hug. It is a holiday season full of crime, cookies, and questionable branding decisions.

entry.title: Miss the Mark
entry.summary:
Author: elihinata

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,911Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 295

Summary: Clark Kent has never shaken the feeling that he doesn’t quite belong. He grew up learning to hide—his strength, his heritage, his very self—all to protect a secret that kept him at arm’s length from everyone around him. But nothing made him feel more alone than discovering the one thing his Kryptonian biology denied him: a soulmate. While every human carried a mark guiding them to someone meant just for them, Clark carried nothing. No promise. No destined other. The more time passes, the heavier that truth becomes, aching under his skin until it finally breaks him. One night, overwhelmed by longing and starved for a connection he fears he’ll never have, Clark gives in to a single reckless impulse. He kisses the one person he trusts most in this world—his best friend, Bruce Wayne.

entry.title: Nobody Told Me University Would Be Like This
entry.summary:
Author: BobBalaban

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,314Chapters: 3/6Kudos: 5

Summary: College certainly wasn’t Bruce Wayne’s idea. If he had his way, he would immediately have started working for his father once he graduated high school. It’s not that he doesn’t love learning, because of course he does, but what he doesn’t love is people. College is a way too social experience for him to be comfortable. But his father and Alfred insisted. Because college is a “great way to find yourself and your people.” He hasn’t done either of those things and it’s already been a year. Sometimes he feels like there is nothing to find within himself. Whatever was there died the night his mother did. OR: an AU in which Bruce attends Gotham University at the request of his father and makes some unexpected friends along the way.

entry.title: Two Heroes and a Baby
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 70,527Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 403

Summary: In this AU, 19-year-old Bruce Wayne adopts 4-year-old Dick Grayson after he is orphaned by a tragic event at Haly's Circus. Bruce is in over his head trying to juggle establishing himself as a responsible and valuable asset to Wayne Enterprises, beginning his vigilante work in Gotham as The Batman, and parenting a young child despite not knowing where to start. After struggling to get good press and constantly being seen as an irresponsible nepo baby, he sets up an interview at The Daily Planet. That's where he meets 19-year-old intern Clark Kent, who is eager to write a good story to begin his career as a journalist. After Clark agrees to keep an eye on Dick during his interview, Bruce realizes he has a knack for watching children, especially young Dick Grayson. Bruce asks Clark to come live with him at Wayne Manor on a 6 month assignment as Dick's nanny, and in return, will let Clark write the story of a lifetime--an expose on his life that no other reporter has even come close to. Clark reluctantly agrees, but is hiding a secret from Bruce--his life as the superhero, Superman! As the two begin their friendship and double lives as heroes, they learn valuable lessons in friendship, love, and parenting.
